name: 跨域藝術互動設計
comment: 此課程為20小時集中密集授課，預計於5月中起每周日授課5小時，連續4周，除正課外會另與講師開設討論會。請選課同學注意E-MAIL信件通知。
restrict: ◎限大三大四 ◎限碩一碩二碩三以上修習
description: 邀請日本慶應義塾大學媒體設計研究室林凱元研究員至本院1個月密集課程開設「知性漫步@臺師大輕旅」科技藝術工作坊，為1學分之微學分工作坊，融合數位媒體、ACG創作，將校園古蹟、生態資訊結合音樂互動之複合型課程。應用科技結合藝術化介面讓訪客或社區民眾在漫遊臺師大時有更多元且個人化體驗的知性輕旅。
goals: 讓學生接觸不同領域可應用的資源
讓學生熟悉跨領域合作模式
syllabus:
**課程主旨 (Goal):**  
Our goal is to develop the computing environment that links our lifestyles, experiences and the Internet together: building the network to engage experience sharing in our daily life. We leverage the Internet to create and share our activities in addition, analyze and predict trends. These activities will develop a way to improve way to share our daily experiences. This unrestricted global environment will improve communication between and within the Internet and the real world, promoting the creation of new products and services. This intensive course set the field inside NTNU, we expect students to rediscover the campus and pull out the hidden touch point for newcomers. The key elements for the lecture will be HCI, J-ACG (included music), and Media design.  
**進度 (schedule):**  
1.Innovation pipeline 1 Media Design  
What is Media and design? We will explore the concept of design in the first class. In addition, we will also understand how the Internet are being incorporated into modern design.  
2.Innovation pipeline 2 Technology  
Modern Media Design requires a technology to realize. We will learn how technology are being put together to implement a design concept: making it into reality. Such software and hardware tools like Arduino or Unity are encouraged to learn in advance, this lecture will focus on application and design but not limits in skill itself. We also welcome different aspect of expression.  
3.Innovation pipeline 3 J-ACG  
"Anime", "Game", "Comic", and "Cosplay" are some of the aggressive and innovative forms of pop culture found in Japan and now spreading worldwide. So called “Otaku” culture are now focused throughout the globe and giving Japan an important role to enhance innovative creativity. We explore the roots of these otaku cultural activities in Japan, considering these contents as a material, Class seeks the international expansion as one of Simulacra delivered by creators, and activists of these fields: How the technology has been created, and knowing its real motivation to drive these sub-cultural activities.  
4.Innovation pipeline 4 Project management  
Learn management-related skills which will be necessary and important for projects to realize. This includes business strategy and model, coordination and behavioral economics.  
5.Design research: Fieldwork and observation  
Design Thinking Introduction, Philosophy, Vision, How to do Fieldwork, Fieldwork Analysis, Mental Model, Target Persona discussion  
6.Design research: Prototyping  
7.Implementation  
Carrying ideas and concepts generated during ethnography phase into the physical form will require several iterations of prototyping. You will be experiencing Structured Design Process and how to identify your prototype idea(s). Identify what are the features and needs of your product.  
8.Final Presentation

methodologies.note: Experiencing design and implementation will be held based on groups. 4 to 6 members per group.
You will be asked to collaborate with students from different disciplines.
Web application, experience device, interactive projection, Others
